headline: Micron and 28 Other S&P 500 Stocks Hit 52-Week Highs on Wednesday. These 12 Are Doing It Again Today.
summary: The stock has gained 241% in 2025, making it one of 2025’s big winners as investors finally realized that AI requires huge amounts of its memory chips.  Its stock was up 1.7%, at $291.67 in premarket trading on Friday as investors looked set to press those bets heading into the end of the year, but was off 0.4% in morning trading.  Lam Research, however, was up 1.1% at $179.28, making it the group’s top gainer.

headline: BlackRock Ramps Up Hiring, Eyes Next Phase of Crypto Expansion
summary: BLK ramps up senior hiring in New York and Singapore to drive crypto, stablecoins and tokenization after its Bitcoin ETF success.

headline: Private credit risks: What to make of Oracle's debt, AI trade
summary: TPW Advisory founder Jay Pelosky and Whalen Global Advisors founder and chairman Chris Whalen come on Market Catalysts to discuss the credit risks materializing in the AI trade and Magnificent Seven tech names, most notably Oracle's (ORCL) growing debt amid concerns of an AI bubble risk. Also catch Jay Pelosky and Chris Whalen share their insights into the banking sector heading into 2026, the next phase in the commodities super cycle, and forecasts on non-US equities. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: How the Narrative Surrounding Armstrong World Industries Is Shifting After Analyst Revisions and Buybacks
summary: Armstrong World Industries has seen its price target lifted as analysts weigh stronger earnings visibility against lingering macro risks. With fair value and long run growth assumptions largely intact, the higher target reflects rising confidence that demand and sector tailwinds can support further upside. Stay tuned to see how investors can track these shifting expectations and stay ahead of the evolving narrative. Stay updated as the Fair Value for Armstrong World Industries shifts by...
